name: Stable
content:
A character who was @Compendium[pf1.conditions.BKxrsHSBNATa0e3D]{Dying} but who has stopped losing hit points each round and still has negative hit points is stable. The character is no longer @Compendium[pf1.conditions.BKxrsHSBNATa0e3D]{Dying}, but is still @Compendium[pf1.conditions.bj36eCfZGJG5AGTQ]{Unconscious}. If the character has become stable because of aid from another character (such as a Heal check or magical healing), then the character no longer loses hit points. The character can make a DC 10 Constitution check each hour to become conscious and @Compendium[pf1.conditions.zW6gVKSaVFTrd9PY]{Disabled} (even though his hit points are still negative). The character takes a penalty on this roll equal to his negative hit point total.

If a character has become stable on his own and hasn’t had help, he is still at risk of losing hit points. Each hour he can make a Constitution check to become stable (as a character that has received aid), but each failed check causes him to lose 1 hit point.
